message: Many of the Brazilian women served as babysitters or helped in the church’s school for little or no pay. The Brazilians told AP they were often physically or verbally assaulted.  “They kept us as slaves,” one former Brazilian church member said. “How can you do that to people – claim you love them and then beat them in the name of God?”

data.description: U.S. Attorney Jill Rose says a joint human-trafficking of Word of Faith Fellowship in Spindale is making “great progress” here and in Brazil.
data.title: NC church known for ‘blasting’ out demons faces growing human-trafficking probe
